intro: Phaca trichopoda, commonly known as the hairy phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a low, spreading habit with hairy stems and leaves. Its small yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Phaca trichopoda is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ability to thrive in sandy soils.
